conversation.ja_sentence: そっか、何とかなるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I see, but everything will be fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: ま、このイベントはバイトの数も含めて、参加者が多いからちょっと圧倒されるかもね。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, there are so many people participating in this event including the temp workers, so it might be a bit overwhelming.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: True.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、いつも使っているお弁当屋に頼むから、向こうが慣れてるはずだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: But we will use the boxed lunch place where we always order from, so they should know what to do.

conversation.ja_sentence: 数さえちゃんと揃っていれば問題ない。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as we have the right number, there shouldn't be any problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、バイトが30人、うちの社員が15人。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, we have 30 temp workers and 12 employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホールのスタッフや照明さんたち、司会やダンサーを入れるとそれくらいだね。
conversation.en_sentence: So it will be about that number including the staff at the venue, lighting people, the MC and dancers.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、それはちょっと違うほうがいいかもな。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, it might be better to have a different one.

conversation.ja_sentence: マネージャーに聞いてみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will ask her manager.

conversation.ja_sentence: お、これは見やすいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, this is easy to see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中村さんはどっちを手伝うのかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Which are you helping, Mika?

conversation.ja_sentence: まとめ役らしいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds like a good supervisor.

conversation.ja_sentence: しっかりやってください。
conversation.en_sentence: Please do your best.

conversation.ja_sentence: バイトの皆さんとは、明日の朝に初顔合わせとなるので、なかなか名前と顔を覚えるのが大変だとは思うけど。
conversation.en_sentence: It may be hard to remember their names and faces since you will only meet the temp workers for the first time only tomorrow morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: お、用意周到だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Ha, you're so prepared.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、これで十分じゃないかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that looks sufficient.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、本番では予想しなかったことが起こるかも知れないから、それは覚悟しておくようにね。
conversation.en_sentence: However, unexpected things could happen at the actual event, so please be prepared for it.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、明日は朝早いので、今日は残業もほどほどに。
conversation.en_sentence: Then don't stay too long tonight since it will be an early morning tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、予約部の川村です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Kawamura from the Reservations Group.

conversation.ja_sentence: 商品企画部の誰かとお話できますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I speak to someone in the Product Planning Group?

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、ヨーロッパのドナウ川クルーズについて問い合わせがあったのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, there was an inquiry about the European Danube River Cruise.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ディナーの時間のことなんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, about the dinner time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 時間が遅すぎるので、もう少し早くしてもらえないか、と。
conversation.en_sentence: It's too late that they want it a bit earlier.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I know.

conversation.ja_sentence: ３時くらいがいいと。
conversation.en_sentence: About three o'clock.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうご説明したんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I did explain that.

conversation.ja_sentence: このツアーのお客さんは、シニアの方ばかりで、どうやら皆さん普段から夕飯の時間がかなり早いようなんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: The customers on this tour are all elderly that their normal dinner time seems to be pretty early.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ、どちらかと言えば早すぎるくらいですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree, it is almost too early if anything.

conversation.ja_sentence: やっぱりそうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: That's what I thought.

conversation.ja_sentence: 無理だとは思ったんですが、一応、企画部にお伝えしておこうと思って。
conversation.en_sentence: I knew it was not possible, but I thought it wouldn't hurt to tell the Planning.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだと思いますが、お客さんの声、ということでメモっておいてください。
conversation.en_sentence: I understand, so please just take a note as the customer feedback.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: もうここでの経験も長いので、どのようにお話すればよいか分かってます。
conversation.en_sentence: I have been working here pretty long, so I know how to talk to them already.

conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に。
conversation.en_sentence: Seriously.

conversation.ja_sentence: 企画するほうも、色々と工夫が必要ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: The planning sides also need to make various arrangements.

conversation.ja_sentence: 若い人向けのツアーとは違って。
conversation.en_sentence: Unlike the tours for young people.

conversation.ja_sentence: 予約部もそれは同じですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It goes the same for the reservations.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I think so.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私田川でよければ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, this is Tagawa and I can talk.

conversation.ja_sentence: 13泊15日間のツアーですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is that the '13 nights 15 days' tour?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、どんな問い合わせでしょう。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, what kind of inquiry was it?

conversation.ja_sentence: え、本当に？
conversation.en_sentence: What, really?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今の旅程表では、クルーズ船上のディナーは全て４時半始まりになっていますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: The current itinerary says all the dinners on the cruise ship will start at four thirty.

conversation.ja_sentence: ヨーロッパ風のゆっくりしたコースディナーなので、数時間かかりますが、始まり時間が遅いとは思えないんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: They serve an European style full-course dinner, so it will take a few hours, but I don't think it starts too early.

conversation.ja_sentence: お客さんは何時がいいとおっしゃっているんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What time do the customers want?

conversation.ja_sentence: え、それだとランチが12時～1時だから、あまりにも時間が近すぎますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, then it's too close to lunch that is from noon to one o'clock

conversation.ja_sentence: それは企画部でも考慮していることで、4時半なら十分に早いかと思ったんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: That is something we at the Planning keep in mind, and we thought four thirty would be early enough.

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、こういう団体ツアーの食事時間は、団体予約を入れられる時間が決まっているので、変更は無理なんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: Um, the meal times for this type of group tours are fixed at when group reservations are accepted, so we can't change.

conversation.ja_sentence: すみませんが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm afraid.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今後のツアー企画の際に参考にさせてもらいます。
conversation.en_sentence: We will take that into consideration for the future tour planning.

conversation.ja_sentence: さすがに3時からディナーという案は無理だとは思いますが。
conversation.en_sentence: Even though I don't think we can start the dinner at three.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: この件、またお客さんに説明するのは大変だと思いますが、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: It will not be easy to explain this to the customers again but thank you for doing it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 色んな問い合わせがあるもんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: There are all kinds of inquiries, aren't there?

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、年齢層が違うと、旅の目的も違いますし。
conversation.en_sentence: I know, the purpose of traveling is different depending on the age.

conversation.ja_sentence: そこがツアー企画の面白さと言えばそうなんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Which is the interesting part of planning tours, I would say.

conversation.ja_sentence: 色んなお客さんがいるから退屈しない、ってことですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Which means that we won't be bored because of different types of customers?

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、D社さんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, is this Company D?

conversation.ja_sentence: 私A社の谷本と申しますが、経理の竹田さんはいらっしゃいますか？
conversation.en_sentence: This is Tanimoto from A Company, and I wonder if Mr. Takeda at the accounting is around?

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社の谷本です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Tanimoto from A Company.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ。
conversation.en_sentence: It has.

conversation.ja_sentence: 実は今日はひとつご相談がありまして。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, I have something I need to ask you today.

conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社のほうで新しい経理システムの導入を検討しているのですが、D社さんのほうでそのシステムを使っていらっしゃると聞きまして。
conversation.en_sentence: We're considering the implementation of a new accounting system, and I heard that Company D is using the same system.

conversation.ja_sentence: で、以前、経理関係の研修でお会いした竹田さんのことを思い出しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I remembered about you, Mr. Takeda, whom I met at an accounting training before.

conversation.ja_sentence: うわ、そんなになりますか。
conversation.en_sentence: Wow, is it that long?

conversation.ja_sentence: それで、このシステムの使い勝手についてお伺いしたかったのですが、よろしいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, I wanted to ask you how it is to use this system, but is it okay with you?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです、どうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, how is it?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、で、その後順調に？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, then has it been good since?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh really.

conversation.ja_sentence: 何しろ、導入にコストがかかるので、簡単に決められないなと思いまして。
conversation.en_sentence: It costs so much to implement, so we really cannot make a decision in a rush.

conversation.ja_sentence: おー、そうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is that right?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは良いことですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's good.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちはD社さんより社員数が少ないので、残業を減らすというのは大きな課題なんですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: We have fewer employees than Company D, so it is our biggest challenge to reduce the overtime.

conversation.ja_sentence: 特に経理担当は人数が少なくて。
conversation.en_sentence: The accounting group especially has very few people.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、考えてみようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe we should consider.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、Mシステムに問い合わせて山本さんとお話できるかどうか頼んでみます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will talk to M Systems and see if I could meet Ms. Yamamoto then.

conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、色々とありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, and thank you for your help.

conversation.ja_sentence: トムさん、今、時間ある？
conversation.en_sentence: Tom, can we talk now?

conversation.ja_sentence: 昨日、うちのホームページの新デザインを見させてもらったんだけど。
conversation.en_sentence: I looked at the new design of our website yesterday.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全体的な色合いはいいと思うんだけど、文字が小さすぎるような気がする。
conversation.en_sentence: I like the overall color scheme, but the font size seems too small to me.

conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、それは分かるけど、うちの商品はシニア対象だからなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: Umm, I understand your points, but our target is the elderly.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちの親とか見てても思うけど、あの年代の人たちは小さい字を読むのは大変だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: When I think of my parents, people that generation have a hard time reading small letters.

conversation.ja_sentence: パッと見たときに字が小さかったら、それだけで何も見てくれないかも知れない。
conversation.en_sentence: If they see small fonts first, they might just stop looking at anything else there.

conversation.ja_sentence: シニア向けマーケティングは、また若い子向けとは別もんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Marketing for the elderly is different from that for the younger generation.

conversation.ja_sentence: 視覚的にあまり刺激が大きくないほうが好まれる。
conversation.en_sentence: They prefer something not so visually stimulating.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホームページも、シンプルなほうがいい。
conversation.en_sentence: Websites should be simple also.

conversation.ja_sentence: リンクも見つけやすくて、クリックしやすいとか。
conversation.en_sentence: Links have to be easy to find and click.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Yup.

conversation.ja_sentence: うちはカタログ販売で始まった企業で、今でもオンラインじゃなくてカタログを見て電話しました、って人のほうが多い。
conversation.en_sentence: We started as a company of catalogue sales, and even now, more people say they called us because of the catalogues rather than the website.

conversation.ja_sentence: シンプルなほうが反応大きいからね。
conversation.en_sentence: The simpler it is, the bigger the responses are.

conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、字は大きめに読みやすく、を心がけるのが一番だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Anyhow, you should remember to keep the letters bigger and easy to read.

conversation.ja_sentence: 少しくらい情報量は減ってもいいから。
conversation.en_sentence: You can cut the amount of information.

conversation.ja_sentence: フォントは今のままでいいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't think you need to change the font.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただサイズがね。
conversation.en_sentence: Just the size.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は個人的にはいいと思うよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I personally think they are good.

conversation.ja_sentence: カタログの雰囲気とマッチしてるし。
conversation.en_sentence: They match our catalogues.

conversation.ja_sentence: いいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure.

conversation.ja_sentence: あ、山田さん、おはよう。
conversation.en_sentence: Hey, Masao, good morning.

conversation.ja_sentence: お客さんを待ってるけど、５分くらいならいいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I have a visitor in 5 minutes, but yes we can.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、どう思う？
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, what do you think?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Really?

conversation.ja_sentence: 情報をたくさん入れようと思うと、どうしてもあのサイズにしないと無理で。
conversation.en_sentence: To put as much information as possible there, I had to pick that size.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにそうだな。
conversation.en_sentence: That's true.

conversation.ja_sentence: 情報をたくさん提供することに囚われていて、それは思いもしなかった。
conversation.en_sentence: All I thought about was to include lots of information, so I didn't even think of that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今までの経験は、若い人向けのウェブデザインが多かったからなぁ。
conversation.en_sentence: My experience of the web design was mostly for the young people.

conversation.ja_sentence: ほんとだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Seriously.

conversation.ja_sentence: そっか。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の親世代のことを考えながらデザインする必要があるね。
conversation.en_sentence: I need to think about my parents' generation when I design.

conversation.ja_sentence: カタログのデザインもシンプルだよね。
conversation.en_sentence: The design of catalogues is simple too.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕にしたら、もうちょっと情報があってもいいんじゃないか、と思えるレベル。
conversation.en_sentence: The level where I would want more info!

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっと文字サイズを変えてみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will try to change the font size.

conversation.ja_sentence: フォントも変えたほうがいいかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Should I change the font itself?

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。
conversation.en_sentence: Got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 色合いはいいって言ったよね。
conversation.en_sentence: You said the colors were good.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、文字サイズだけ触るよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Then I'll just work on the font size.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとでまた見てくれる？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you take a look later?

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社さんですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, is this Company A?

conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書の発行についてお尋ねしたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to ask you about issuing an invoice.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、B社経理の岡本と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Keisuke at Company B's Accounting.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつも商品を買わせていただいており、お世話になっております。
conversation.en_sentence: You are one of our vendors and we appreciate your services.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は、かなり前にうちの購買が注文したファイバーケーブルの請求書について質問があってお電話しました。
conversation.en_sentence: I am calling you because I wanted to ask you about the invoice for fiber cabes our Purchase Group ordered a while ago.

conversation.ja_sentence: 商品が届いてから二か月になるのですが、まだ請求書が届いていないので、どうなっているのかなと思いまして。
conversation.en_sentence: It's been two months since we'd received the order, but we still don't have the invoice for it, so I wonder what is happening.

conversation.ja_sentence: よろしくお願いいたします。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 発注日は1月25日、発注書番号はB1564です。
conversation.en_sentence: The date we ordered was Janurary twenty-fifth, and the PO number is B1564,

conversation.ja_sentence: ちなみに、注文額は6250円で、ケーブルは５本頼んでいます。
conversation.en_sentence: For your information, the order amount was 6250 yen for 5 cables.

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: それで請求書が発行されていなかったんですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That's why the invoice wasn't issued.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宅配便の伝票がありますが、それでいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: I have a delivery slip from the carrier, would that work?

conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: No problem.

conversation.ja_sentence: 川口さん宛てに送ればいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can I just send it to you?

conversation.ja_sentence: では、電話を切ったらすぐに送らせていただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll do it as soon as I hang up.

conversation.ja_sentence: 請求書はいつ頃いただけるでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: When can I expect the invoice?

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、こちらの締め日に間に合うので助かります。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that will make it to our closing date, so great.

conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社の予算の都合で、早く処理しないといけない案件だったもので。
conversation.en_sentence: It is something that I needed to take care of soon because of our budget situation.

conversation.ja_sentence: いえいえ、お互い忙しい時期でしたし、こんなこともありますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: No worries, things slip out sometimes especially when everyone is busy.

conversation.ja_sentence: 敏速に対応していただいて助かりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for taking care of it so quickly.

conversation.ja_sentence: 野口さん、先週はサンフランシスコ出張ご苦労様でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Noguchi, I hope you had a nice trip to San Francisco last week.

conversation.ja_sentence: お疲れのところ申し訳ないのですが、今週中に出張費の清算をお願いできますか。
conversation.en_sentence: I feel bad for asking when you're still tired, but can you finish your expense report for the trip this week?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今週中に精算書を提出いただかないと、翌月経費扱いになって払い戻しが遅れてしまいます。
conversation.en_sentence: If you don't submit your expense report this week, it won't be processed as this month's expense and you won't get paid until later.

conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: Appreciate it.

conversation.ja_sentence: すいませんが、それはちょっと。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm afraid not.

conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的には、社員同士は接待できないというルールになっています。
conversation.en_sentence: Basically our employees cannot entertain each other.

conversation.ja_sentence: すいません。
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry.

conversation.ja_sentence: ランチ代はお支払いできなくてすいません。
conversation.en_sentence: I feel bad we can't pay for the lunch.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、空港まで自分の車で行かれたのであれば、それは清算できるのでして下さいね。
conversation.en_sentence: But you can definitely expense it if you used your own car to go to the airport..

conversation.ja_sentence: 精算書の指定欄に運転キロ数を入れていただくと自動計算されるようになっています。
conversation.en_sentence: If you enter the number of kilos in the assigned column on the form, it will automatically be calculated.

conversation.ja_sentence: 領収書さえあれば。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as you have receipts.

conversation.ja_sentence: 頑張って探してくださいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Good luck finding them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 領収証さえあれば、請求された額はちゃんと払い戻しますので。
conversation.en_sentence: As long as you have all the receipts, you will get paid the full amount you claim.

conversation.ja_sentence: 出張の際に、領収書専用のフォルダーを使ってみてはどうですか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about trying to use a folder to keep your receipts when you travel?

conversation.ja_sentence: もらった領収書はそこに全部入れるようにすれば、後で探すのが楽だと思うんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: If you put all the receipts in there, it will be easier to find them later.

conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ。
conversation.en_sentence: Great.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、取り急ぎ今回の出張費精算、早めにお願いします。

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウェイン ジャックソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can provide you with the operational know-how.
conversation.ja_sentence: 弊社に運営のノウハウをご提供できます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウェイン ジャックソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Interesting observation.
conversation.ja_sentence: ユニークな見解ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウェイン ジャックソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to close the deal by the end of next month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来月末までには契約を済ませたいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウェイン ジャックソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can convince your management?
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらの経営陣を説得できると思いますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ウェイン ジャックソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: 承知しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ウェイン ジャックソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But please let me know by the end of next week.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも来週末までにはご連絡ください。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hi, this is Terry Coleman from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、Ａ社のテリー コールマンです。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I've been busy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近忙しくて。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So, it's actually been around six months since we last talked.
conversation.ja_sentence: いやー、最後に電話で話して以来実際に６ヶ月ほど経ってしまいましたよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Time flies doesn't it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 時間はあっという間に過ぎますね。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to just catch up and see if there were any new developments on your side.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらで何か新しい展開があったかどうか聞きたいと思ったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: And to see if there are any opportunities for us to work together.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、また一緒に仕事をするチャンスがあれば、と思って。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So you guys aren't going to build that plant anymore?
conversation.ja_sentence: ということはもう工場は建設しないんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: That's unfortunate.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは残念ですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Our core business is still doing well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちのメインビジネスはまだ順調ですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But our new venture on the new technology has been a bit slow.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも新技術に関する新しい事業はちょっと滞っています。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: There is a lot of interest but no takers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多数から興味を持っていただいていますが、まだ導入先がありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Exactly.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Once someone takes the risk and demonstrates it then everything will fall into piece though.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰かがリスクを負って実証できれば後は収まるべきところに収まるんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We have considered it in the past but running our own plant isn't part of our main business.
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去に考えたことはありますが、自分たちで工場を運営するのは私たちのメインビジネスではないんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: So our management voted against it.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、経営陣はそれに反対しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: They are still adamant on licensing the technology rather than risking it ourselves.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らはリスクを自分で負うより技術をライセンスすることを譲りません。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、もちろんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: テリー コールマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hope you have a nice day.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良い日をお過ごしください。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh hi, Terry.
conversation.ja_sentence: おー、やあ、テリー。

conversation.en_sentence: How have you been?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's good to hear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはよかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes it does.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, maybe I can give you an update of what we have been up to.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、じゃあ私たちの近況をお伝えしますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: As you know, we were pursuing an opportunity in building our own plant for the last year or so.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご存知の通り、ここ１年あたりで私どもは自社工場を建設しようと機会を狙っています。

conversation.en_sentence: However, since the technology we are using is a new technology that hasn't been commercialized, it's been a bit difficult to get internal approvals.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、私たちが使っている技術がまだ商用化していない新技術なので、社内の承認を取るのにちょっと苦戦しています。

conversation.en_sentence: So as of two months ago, we decided to pivot, and focus more on just the trading side.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は２ヶ月前に軸を決めて、貿易面だけにもっと焦点を当てることに決めたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: No, unfortunately not.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、残念ですが。

conversation.en_sentence: The pros and cons didn't weigh out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良い点と悪い点のバランスが取れませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: So how have things been on your side?
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらの方はいかがですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's the classic chicken and egg scenario isn't it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昔からある鶏と卵の話ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Has your company ever thought of taking that risk?
conversation.ja_sentence: おたくの会社はそのリスクを負うことを考えたことありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I know your company is an engineering company but is that a possibility?
conversation.ja_sentence: おたくの会社はエンジニアリング会社だというのはわかっていますが、その可能性はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Ah, I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうなんですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, let me know if there are any companies that will take that risk.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、そのリスクを負う会社があったら教えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: We would be interested in buying the product.
conversation.ja_sentence: 商品を買うことには興味があります。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, thank you very much for the call today.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、今日は電話をくださってありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: It was nice catching up with you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 近況をお話しできてよかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではまた。

conversation.en_sentence: I think somebody stole my tablet.
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰かが私のタブレットを盗んだと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you sure you didn't misplace it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 休憩室のテーブルの上に置いて、急いで自分のデスクにお弁当箱を取りに行ったの。

conversation.en_sentence: When I came back, my tablet was gone.
conversation.ja_sentence: 戻ってきたら、タブレットがなくなっていたの。

conversation.en_sentence: Positive!
conversation.ja_sentence: それは絶対にないよ！

conversation.en_sentence: I left it right on the table.
conversation.ja_sentence: テーブルの上に置いていたはずだから。

conversation.en_sentence: I was going to read a book on my tablet while I eat.
conversation.ja_sentence: 食事中にタブレットで読書をするつもりだった。

conversation.en_sentence: Then I realized I had forgotten my lunch box at my desk.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもデスクにお弁当箱を忘れたのを思い出したの。

conversation.en_sentence: I am afraid we have a thief at this office.
conversation.ja_sentence: このオフィスに泥棒がいるんだと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: This isn't the first time stuff went missing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 物が無くなったのは今回が初めてじゃないし。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you remember Stacey looking for her phone last week?
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週ステイシーの電話が無くなったのを覚えてる？

conversation.en_sentence: I also know there has been some personal food missing from the refrigerator too.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから冷蔵庫からは個人の食べ物が無くなったりしてるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am going to suggest at the next monthly meeting that we install a surveillance camera in our breakroom.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来月のミーティングで休憩室に監視カメラを設置する様に提案してみようと思ってる。

conversation.en_sentence: A surveillance camera will definitely prevent theft for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: 監視カメラは絶対に窃盗を防ぐはずだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Or it will catch a thief in the act.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは、泥棒を現行犯で見つける事もできる。

conversation.en_sentence: Wait until you get your item stolen.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分の物が盗まれてごらん。

conversation.en_sentence: Then you will want a camera in every corner of every room.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしたら全ての部屋の隅々にカメラを置きたくなるはずだから。

conversation.en_sentence: There will be quite a few people backing up my suggestion.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の提案に賛成してくれる人が結構いるはずだから。

conversation.en_sentence: Who wants a thief snooping around in our office?
conversation.ja_sentence: オフィス内で泥棒がこそこそしているのを好む人なんていないでしょう？

conversation.en_sentence: Some people don't have moral compass.
conversation.ja_sentence: 倫理基準がない人もいるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope so too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなる事を願っているわ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am about show you how to handle phone calls.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今から電話対応の仕方を教えます。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you had a chance to read through the sample scripts?
conversation.ja_sentence: 例文スクリプトを読む機会はありましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: You are going to use those scripts as guidelines and tweak them as you go.
conversation.ja_sentence: スクリプトをガイドラインとして使用して、状況によって訂正してみて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: The most important thing here is you stay calm and keep your composure.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一番大切な事は落ち着いて、取り乱さない事です。

conversation.en_sentence: Also you need to stay professional.
conversation.ja_sentence: それと、ちゃんとプロフェッショナルでいる事。

conversation.en_sentence: You should already know how to pull up each customer's order information.
conversation.ja_sentence: お客様の個人オーダー情報の出し方はもう知っていますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Most customers will not give you a hard time if you give them the correct information they need.
conversation.ja_sentence: きちんと必要な情報を伝えれば、大抵のお客様は文句を言ってくる事はありません。

conversation.en_sentence: But there are callers who are upset and hostile too.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも中には怒っていて敵対心を持っている人もいます。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you do not take those calls personally.
conversation.ja_sentence: その様なコールを個人的に受け取らないようにしてください。

conversation.en_sentence: When you pick up a phone call, you need to give a great impression.
conversation.ja_sentence: 電話を取る際は、良い印象を与えないといけません。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, go ahead and try.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあやってみて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds very friendly and sincere.
conversation.ja_sentence: フレンドリーで誠実そうに聞こえますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You do not need to sound overly excited.
conversation.ja_sentence: そこまで活気がなくてもいいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure you stay polite.
conversation.ja_sentence: 礼儀正しくして下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Also refer each customer by his or her last name.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、お客様を苗字で呼んでください。

conversation.en_sentence: That's perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: 完璧です。

conversation.en_sentence: It can be stressful to deal with angry customers at times.
conversation.ja_sentence: 怒ってらっしゃるお客様に対応するのは精神的に疲れてしまう事もあります。

conversation.en_sentence: I prefer to have you take care of such calls on your own.
conversation.ja_sentence: そういう時もなるべく自分の力で対応して欲しいと思っています。

conversation.en_sentence: But do not hesitate to ask me for help.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも私に助けを求める事を躊躇わないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: It's my job to assist you.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたを助ける事が私の仕事です。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have the one from our accountant?
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会計士からの手紙はある？

conversation.en_sentence: There it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: あった。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is an important mail I was supposed to receive 3 days ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大事な手紙で三日前に受け取る予定だったの。

conversation.en_sentence: It's not your fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたのせいじゃないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I called my accountant three times to make sure he had mailed it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんと送ったのか確認する為に会計士に３回も電話したのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He dropped it off at the post office Monday.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は月曜日に郵便局に持っていったの。

conversation.en_sentence: Usually it doesn't take this long, so I was starting to worry.
conversation.ja_sentence: 通常はこんなに時間がかからないから、心配になってきた所だったの。

conversation.en_sentence: No, you brought them just in time.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、ぴったりのタイミングで持ってきてくれたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I am upset that the mail carrier made a mistake again.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ郵便配達員がまた間違ったのが腹立つわ。

conversation.en_sentence: This is the third time in a month.
conversation.ja_sentence: この一か月で３回目よ。

conversation.en_sentence: But I might say something to him.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも彼に何か言おうと思うの。

conversation.en_sentence: Being new can not be an excuse.
conversation.ja_sentence: 新入社員だからというのは言い訳にはならないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Some of the letters we receive are urgent and confidential.
conversation.ja_sentence: 受け取る手紙の中には、至急、機密のものもあるからね。

conversation.en_sentence: He can not keep messing up our mails.
conversation.ja_sentence: このままうちの郵便物を誤配達されるわけにはいかないの。

conversation.en_sentence: Or anybody's mail.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の会社の郵便物もね。

conversation.en_sentence: Next time my mail gets misdelivered, I will let the postmaster know about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 次回誤配達されたら、郵便局長に連絡するわ。

conversation.en_sentence: The mail carrier needs to be more responsible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 配達員はもう少し責任感がないといけない。

conversation.en_sentence: That's a good idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはいい考えだね。

conversation.en_sentence: I am pretty sure Mr. Henry will not mind it at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: ヘンリーさんも気にしないと思うわ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you again for bringing my mails, Ryoji.
conversation.ja_sentence: 亮二、手紙を持ってきてくれて有難う。

conversation.en_sentence: Mrs. Maki, I am afraid I have to leave soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 真希さん、申し訳ないのですが早退せざるを得なくなりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I just got a phone call from my daughter's daycare.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今娘の保育園から電話があったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: She has a fever of 103 and is non stop throwing up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 103度の熱があって、ずっと嘔吐しているらしいです。

conversation.en_sentence: I was asked to come pick her up as soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 直ぐに迎えに来るようにと言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: But I know this is not the ideal time for me to leave.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもこのタイミングで早退できないのは承知しています。

conversation.en_sentence: We are about to have a meeting with company K.
conversation.ja_sentence: もうすぐK社とのミーティングが始まりますし。

conversation.en_sentence: My husband is away on a bussiness trip.
conversation.ja_sentence: 主人は出張で留守中です。

conversation.en_sentence: And all my family members live out of town.
conversation.ja_sentence: 家族も皆市外に住んでいるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I just don't have anybody else to go get her.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので娘を迎えに行ける人が居ないんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I asked Andrew to cover my part at the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングはアンドリューに私の代わりを務めるようにお願いしました。

conversation.en_sentence: He has all the handouts I printed out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 印刷済の資料も渡しています。

conversation.en_sentence: And I just got done setting up the Power Point slide show.
conversation.ja_sentence: あとパワーポイントのスライドの準備も今終わった所です。

conversation.en_sentence: Andrew is currently checking to see if they are in the correct order.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今アンドリューが順番が正しいか確かめているところです。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I was actually going to do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうする予定でした。

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、先に許可を頂きたくて。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I do, but we have this important meeting today.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、でも今日は重要なミーティングが入っていたので。

conversation.en_sentence: I really hate to miss it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出席できないのが悔やまれます。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much for your kind understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解頂き、有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I will keep you posted on my daughter.
conversation.ja_sentence: また後で娘の事で連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: I might have to take tomorrow off depending on her condition.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の体調次第では明日も休みを取るかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: I just hope I didn't forget anything.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何も忘れていないといいんですが。

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、モニターのレンタルについてアンディーに電話しましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'm pretty sure we brought everything.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、間違いなく全部持ってきたと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: We should land in about an hour.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと1時間程度で着陸するはずです。

conversation.ja_sentence: ラスベガスに行ったことはありますか？

conversation.ja_sentence: コーポレートシアターって何ですか？

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど、ゲームエキスポに行ったことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: You'll like it, it's a lot of fun.

conversation.en_sentence: Anyways, for our itinerary we will all meet at the booth at 8 am tomorrow.

conversation.en_sentence: Well, don't show up hungover tomorrow.

conversation.en_sentence: I'm taking out some clients from Game Company A out to dinner and a show.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はゲーム A社からの何人かの顧客をディナーとショーに連れ出す予定です。

conversation.en_sentence: We're starting out at Steakhouse B then we're going to the Circus show.
conversation.ja_sentence: ステーキハウスBから始めて、それからサーカスショーに行きます。

conversation.ja_sentence: サーカスショーA、ほとんど空中アクロバットなどです。

conversation.ja_sentence: 確か15かそこらの違うバージョンがあるんですよね？

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ネームタグは忘れてませんよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I used to do corporate theater a lot out here.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、私はここでコーポレートシアターをよくやっていました。

conversation.en_sentence: It's mostly sets for presentations at conferences.
conversation.ja_sentence: 主に会議でのプレゼンテーション用のセットです。

conversation.en_sentence: We designed the sets ourselves, then we set them up and broke them all down.
conversation.ja_sentence: セットをデザインし、それからそれらを設営し、解体するんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: No, this is my first time.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、これが初めてです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh yeah, I know.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、分かっていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: In fact, I've already made plans.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、私はもう予定を立てています。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh come on, this is Las Vegas!
conversation.ja_sentence: 堅いこと言わないでくださいよ、ラスベガスですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, Lisa and I are going to see a magic show.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は、リサと私はマジックショーを見に行くんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's Fat Bob and Cookie.
conversation.ja_sentence: ファットボブとクッキーです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they do magic and comedy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、彼らはマジックとコメディをするんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Fat Bob talks all the time and tells jokes.
conversation.ja_sentence: ファットボブはずっと話していて冗談を言っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Cookie never talks at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: クッキーは決して話しません。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, they are stupid, but they're actually really good at magic.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、彼らは面白いけれど、本当にマジックも上手いんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What are you getting into tonight Chris?
conversation.ja_sentence: クリス、あなたは今夜何を予定していますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh wow, which show are you going to catch?
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、どのショーを見に行くんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You're going to love it.
conversation.ja_sentence: きっと気に入りますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I saw Circus Show B, it had acrobats, and there was a live band that played a tribute to Rock Band B.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はサーカスショーBを見たんですが、アクロバットも有り、ロックバンドBのトリビュートを演奏したライブバンドも有りました。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I'd really like to see them all.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、本当に全部見たいです。

conversation.en_sentence: Hey John, what brings you into Human Resources today?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョン、こんにちは、今日は人事部へなんの御用でしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing John, What's going on exactly?
conversation.ja_sentence: わかったわ、ジョン、一体どうしました？

conversation.en_sentence: A 401(k) is an employer sponsored retirement plan where you can make salary-deferral contributions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 401（k）は、給与繰延拠出をすることができる雇用主が後援する退職金制度です。

conversation.en_sentence: And here at Company A, we actually match your contribution up to 4%.
conversation.ja_sentence: そしてここA社では、実際にあなたの貢献に対して最高4％まで補助出来ます。

conversation.en_sentence: It is then put into an account, and invested into various stocks, then when you retire, you can have it.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは口座に保管されて様々な株に投資されます、そしてあなたが退職するときそれを受け取ることができるんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course, after all it is your money.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、元々はあなたのお金ですから。

conversation.en_sentence: There are quite a few stipulations though.
conversation.ja_sentence: かなりの規定がありますが。

conversation.en_sentence: First, you won't receive the amount of money that we have matched.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず、あなたは私たちが補助した金額を受け取ることはありません。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, you will have to pay 20% of the amount in taxes and 10% penalty if you withdraw it early.
conversation.ja_sentence: また、あなたがそれを早く引き出した場合、税金として20％と10%のペナルティを支払わなければなりません。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, they do.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、かかりますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why it makes sense to keep it invested for the long term.
conversation.ja_sentence: だからこそ、長期にわたって投資を続けることが理にかなっているのです。

conversation.en_sentence: First of all, you have a yearly deduct-able of 1,000 dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず第一に、あなたの保険には年間1,000ドルのディダクタブルがあります。

conversation.en_sentence: It means that if you go to the hospital, you have to pay the first 1,000 dollars of the bill per year.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは、あなたが病院に行く場合、年間の請求書の最初の1,000ドルを支払わなければならないことを意味します。

conversation.en_sentence: However, with that being said, you do have a 20 dollars copay for regular visits to a clinic.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけどそれとは別に、あなたの保険には診療所を定期訪問する際の20ドルの自己負担額が付帯しています。

conversation.en_sentence: So, if you just catch the flu or strep throat or something simple, you only have to pay 20 dollars per visit.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですから、インフルエンザや咽頭炎、あるいは何か単純なものであれば、1回の訪問につき20ドル払うだけで済みます。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, but just between you and me, our entire insurance system is awful.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かにね、でもここだけの話、私たちの保険システム全体はひどいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't even understand why it has to go through our jobs.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全く、会社を通している意味があるのかしらね。

conversation.en_sentence: If you're injured at work, it would fall under worker's compensation, and you wouldn't have to pay anything, nor would it affect your insurance.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたが仕事で怪我をした場合、それは労働者補償に該当し、あなたは何も支払う必要はありませんし、それは保険にも影響を与えません。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a lot to take in.
conversation.ja_sentence: 理解することは沢山あるわね。

conversation.en_sentence: My door is always open if you have any other questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他に質問があればいつでもきてくださいね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello customer service, this is Lisa speaking.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、カスタマーサービスのリサです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: May I ask, who I am speaking to?
conversation.ja_sentence: お名前を教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: How can I help you today, Ms. Sully?
conversation.ja_sentence: サリーさん、今日はどんなご用件でしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: I am sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Would you be able to check if the appliance is in the power socket?
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品がコンセントに入っているかどうか確認していただくことはできますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Good, now will you press the ON button?
conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ、そしてオンのボタンを押してみてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you please check with another appliance and see if the electrical socket is properly working?
conversation.ja_sentence: そのコンセントが正常に機能しているか、他の家電製品で調べていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: I see, as it did work a couple of times, there must be some fault with the product.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか、２、３回はきちんと動いたということですし、それは製品に問題があるようですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will send you an email with instructions on how to return the item.
conversation.ja_sentence: 返品方法についてのメールをお送りさせていただきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Since you've told me that you had just purchased the product, it will be under warranty.
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品を買われたばかりということですので、まだ保証期間中です。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: We can send you a new one straight away, would you like me to do that?
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに新しいものをお送りできますが、それでよろしいでしょうか。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: The email I am sending you will give you all those options, how to return the item.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が送るメールには、返品の仕方のオプションが全て記載されています。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: As well as how to request a new product to be sent to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: どのように新品を送ってもらうかという請求方法についても。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will you give me your email address?
conversation.ja_sentence: メールアドレスを教えていただけますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: jen888@xxx.com, is that correct?
conversation.ja_sentence: jen888@xxx.comでよろしいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should get an email from us soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: すぐに弊社からメールが届くはずです。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please follow the instructions and if there're any questions, please call us again.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご案内に従ってください、ご質問があればまたお電話ください。

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else I can help you with Ms. Sully?

conversation.ja_speaker: リサ カザーレさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for calling in, have a nice rest of your day.
conversation.ja_sentence: お電話ありがとうございました、よい一日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、御社商品の一つに問題があってお電話したのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Jen, Jen Sully.
conversation.ja_sentence: ジェンです、ジェンサリー。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I purchased this coffee grinder online the other day...
conversation.ja_sentence: 先日、このコーヒーミルをオンラインで購入しました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I used it a couple of times and it was working fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２、３度使ってみて、ちゃんと使えたんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: But now it's not working any more...
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、今全く動かなくなったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: What do you think is the problem?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何が問題だと思いますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、入ってます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will try unplugging and plug it in again.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一度コンセントから抜いて、再度入れてみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: OK, nothing...
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、何も起こりません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will try that...
conversation.ja_sentence: やってみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the socket is working fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、コンセントはちゃんと使えます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: What should I do?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうすればよいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great!
conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かります！

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can also return the item to the website I bought it from....
conversation.ja_sentence: 購入したウェブサイトで返品も出来ますが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: OK, that sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、それでいいです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it's jen888@xxx.com.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、jen888@xxx.comです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that's right.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、合ってます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sure, I will wait for your email and go from there.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、メールが届くのを待って、そこからやってみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think that will be it for now, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今のところそれだけです、ありがとうございました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジェン サリーさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your help Lisa and same to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: リサさん、ありがとう、そちらもよい一日を。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, my name is Yumi McGuire and I am with Company R.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、私、マクガイア由美と申します、R社の。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to bother you, is this a good time to talk?
conversation.ja_sentence: お忙しいところすみませんが、今いいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, well I wanted to discuss with you about a potential business opportunity.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、あの、お仕事をご一緒させていただけるかどうかについてお話したいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Um, yes, who am I talking with?
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうです、あなたがそうでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, it's xxxx-xxxx.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、xxxx-xxxxです。

conversation.en_sentence: When should I expect a call?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつ頃お電話いただけますでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, thank you, I'll try and call back at a later date as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ありがとうございました、こちらからも後日また連絡させてきただきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Do I really have to call him over and over?
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に何度も何度も電話する必要はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, this is Yumi McGuire.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、由美 マクガイアですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh hello Mr. Lofstrom, yes thank you for calling back.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、もしもし、ロフストロームさんですか、はい、折り返しご連絡ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to contact you regarding a potential business arrangement.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一緒にお仕事ができるかどうかについてお話したかったのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me?
conversation.ja_sentence: あのそれは？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry, I'm a little confused.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、ちょっと状況が分からないのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: We have a contract?
conversation.ja_sentence: 契約をしていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I think there has been some internal miscommunication so let me get back to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社内でコミュニケーション不足があったようですので、後で折り返し連絡させてください。

conversation.en_sentence: He says there is already a contract.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼は、もう契約したって言ってました。

conversation.en_sentence: That a deal was made last weekend with G Trading over golf.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週末G貿易とのゴルフ中に取引が決まったって。

conversation.en_sentence: And Mr. Ko doesn't think this looks sloppy to other people?
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、高さんが周りの人に対して不真面目な印象を与えることになりませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: Like we don't have it together internally?
conversation.ja_sentence: 社内で情報が共有されていないみたいで？

conversation.en_sentence: I can't believe he thinks this is acceptable.
conversation.ja_sentence: これで大丈夫と思うなんて信じられません。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for calling Company V, this is Jeremy.
conversation.ja_sentence: お電話ありがとうございます、V社、ジェレミーです。

conversation.en_sentence: How can I serve you today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はどんなご用件でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません。

conversation.en_sentence: What is the trouble specifically?
conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的にどんな問題でしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, and have you considered using the "customize report" menu?
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、「カスタマイズレポート」メニューを使ってみたことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか。

conversation.en_sentence: So you'd like to do it automatically?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、それを自動的にやりたいということでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I can definitely tell you a way to do that automatically, but it is a little technical.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん自動で出来るやり方をお教えすることはできますが、少し難しくなりますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Have you ever written HTML?
conversation.ja_sentence: HTMLを書いたことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, the solution I'm going to share with you requires the user to create a custom format by editing an HTML default format.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、私が今からお教えする解決方法は、ユーザーがHTMLのデフォルトフォーマットを編集することでカスタマイズされたフォーマットを作るということなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We certainly do have a terms database and we also have a Frequently Asked Questions page as well as a thorough forum thread on the matter.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんと用語データベースがありますし、「よくある質問」ページ、この内容に関する徹底したフォーラムページもご用意しています。

conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to email you the links to the resources I mentioned.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先ほどお話したリソースのリンクをメールしたいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: May I have your email address please?
conversation.ja_sentence: メールアドレスを教えていただけますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, Alice.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、アリスさん。

conversation.en_sentence: I've just sent the email now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、メールを送りました。

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: よかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Please take a look through these and take a stab at it and get back to us if you have any questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: これらをまず読んで試してみてください、それで何か質問があればまたご連絡ください。

conversation.en_sentence: It's my pleasure.
conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything else I can help you with today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日、何か他にお手伝いできることはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, then I hope you have a good day and please don't hesitate to call with further questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かさらにご質問があればお気軽にご連絡ください、ではよい一日を。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Tom, this is Sam from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: トムさん、こちらA社のサムです。

conversation.en_sentence: How are you today.
conversation.ja_sentence: お元気ですか。

conversation.en_sentence: So, I'm calling today as I wanted to follow up on the insurance quote.
conversation.ja_sentence: さて、今日は、保険の見積についてのフォローとしてお電話差し上げたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you sent me a draft quote but I had some questions I wanted to ask.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見積のドラフトを送ってくださっているのですが、少し質問したいことがありまして。

conversation.en_sentence: I actually sent the questions via email two weeks ago and just wanted to know if you had a look at it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は２週間前に質問をメールさせていただいたんですが、見ていただけましたでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: The draft quote included our export operations but I couldn't find anything on our import operations.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見積のドラフトには、弊社の輸出活動は入っていたのですが、輸入活動に関することが見つけられませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: I sent that information when you first made the draft quote in the form you asked me to fill out.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最初にトムさんが見積のドラフトを作った際に私が記入しないといけなかったフォームに、その情報は書いてあります。

conversation.en_sentence: How about I send you the information again through email and you can take a look at it.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールで再度情報を送りますので、見ていただけないでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, thank you for your time today.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、今日はお時間ありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it was.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I can't believe he is asking me what the sales amount for our import operations is.
conversation.ja_sentence: 輸入活動の売上額はいくらだと聞いてくるなんて、信じられないですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I sent him that information a long time ago.
conversation.ja_sentence: かなり前に情報は送っていたんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think he read the file he asked me to fill out for him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼のほうが記入するように頼んできたのにファイルを見ていないと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean, if you want my business, you should at least try a bit harder.
conversation.ja_sentence: まったく持って、もし一緒に仕事がしたいなら、もう少し努力してもいいんじゃないでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, but he's not doing a good job at it.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、でも、全然ちゃんとしてないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He takes forever to reply and doesn't even read the information I give him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 返事はなかなか来ないし、こちらからの情報は見もしません。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I saw that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そう思いました。

conversation.en_sentence: So the reason we requested this meeting today is not to request for funding but to seek a business partnership.

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds great.

conversation.en_sentence: I love how you enjoy the season everyday.

conversation.en_sentence: You love it rain or shine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 出る前にこの小さなキャンディをもらいたいね。

conversation.ja_sentence: どういたしまして。

conversation.en_sentence: It helps me, actually.

conversation.en_sentence: Sure!
conversation.ja_sentence: うん！

conversation.en_sentence: It's perfect weather for a walk.
conversation.ja_sentence: 散歩には最高の天気だね。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't know.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ日々の天気が好きなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Asano, sorry for calling you to come in such a short notice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 以前から話に出てきた君の海外赴任についてだ。
conversation.en_sentence: This is about you relocating to overseas which we have been talking about.

conversation.ja_sentence: ５月１日付けで君にロサンゼルスに行ってもらうことになった。
conversation.en_sentence: We are assigning you to go to Los Angeles as of May 1st.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君はサンフランシスコを希望していたようだが、ロサンゼルスで事業拡大の機会を調査してもらいたい。
conversation.en_sentence: I know you wanted to go to San Francisco, but I want you to research opportunities to expand our business in Los Angeles.

conversation.ja_sentence: 任期は最低３年、場合によっては延長となる。
conversation.en_sentence: Your term will be at least three years, and it will be extended depending on circumstances.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご家族はどうするかね？
conversation.en_sentence: What are your going to do about your family?

conversation.ja_sentence: それがいいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君のビザはすぐに申請するので再来月に間に合うと思うが、ご家族のビザはもう少し時間がかかるかもしれない。
conversation.en_sentence: We will apply your visa soon, so it will hopefully be issued in time by the month after next, but visas for your family might take longer.

conversation.ja_sentence: ビザはＬ１だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Your visa will be L1.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず君が先に行って、後からご家族が渡米だな。
conversation.en_sentence: You will go there first, then your family will go to US afterwards.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最初の一年の住居はロサンゼルス支社が決めるが、２年目は予算内なら自分で探したところに引っ越してもいい。
conversation.en_sentence: Your first year residence will be determined by our Los Angeles office, but you may move to a place that you find on the second year, as long as it is within our budget.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君が慣れるまでロサンゼルス支社の田沼君にしばらく君のお世話を頼むことにする。
conversation.en_sentence: I will ask Mr. Tanuma from Los Angeles office to take care of you until you find your way around.

conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ生まれだが、日本語も完璧な優秀な人だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Although he was born in the US, his Japanese is perfect, and he is excellent all around.

conversation.ja_sentence: 車も会社持ちでリースするが、まずは運転免許の取得が必要だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Your car will be leased by the company, but you need to get a driver's license first.

conversation.ja_sentence: お子さんの幼稚園も考えないといかんな。
conversation.en_sentence: You have to think about your child's kindergarten.

conversation.ja_sentence: 赴任の準備で忙しくなるが、よろしく頼む。
conversation.en_sentence: You will be busy preparing for the move, please take care.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かった。
conversation.en_sentence: Glad to hear.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君には期待しているよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I am counting on you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の海外事業拡大のカギだ。
conversation.en_sentence: You are the key to expand our company's business overseas.

conversation.ja_sentence: 赴任前に一度一緒に夕食はどうだ？
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't we have dinner together before you move?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 日本人はプレゼント交換は好きですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do Japanese people like gift exchanges?

conversation.ja_sentence: それなら、ホワイトエレファントは好きかもしれないです。
conversation.en_sentence: If so, then a white elephant might be good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 簡単にいえば、ユニークなプレゼント交換という感じですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Basically, it is a unique gift exchange.

conversation.ja_sentence: 各自１０００円ほどの面白いプレゼントを用意します。
conversation.en_sentence: Each one of us prepares a unique gift that's about one thousand yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: そして誰が買ったものか分からないよう一箇所に集めて、一人ずつ順番にプレゼントを選んで開けていくんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Then we put those in one place without telling who bought it, and pick and open a gift one by one.

conversation.ja_sentence: それだけで終わりじゃないですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: That's not all.

conversation.ja_sentence: 二番目の人は新しくプレゼントを開けるか、前に開けられた他の人のプレゼントを奪う事ができます。
conversation.en_sentence: The second person can either open a new gift or steal a gift from another person.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の人に自分が開けたプレゼントを盗まれたら、また新しくオープンするか盗むか選択できます。
conversation.en_sentence: If someone steals the gift you opened, you can pick a new one to open or steal another one.

conversation.ja_sentence: これを全員のプレゼントが確定するまでひたすらやるんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: We continue doing that until everyone's gifts are decided.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一つのプレゼントを盗めるのは3回だけですので、大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: One gift can be stolen up to three times, so that's fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最後までハラハラドキドキしてとても楽しいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's exciting until the end of the game.

conversation.ja_sentence: もし家に要らないものがあったらそれでもいいんですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: It's ok if you have something you don't need in your house.

conversation.ja_sentence: ホワイトエレファントというのは、要らないものという意味があるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: White elephant also means an unnecessary thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: 要らないものを処分しつつも、みんなで楽しもうという事です。
conversation.en_sentence: It is that we should have fun, while getting rid of things we don't need.

conversation.ja_sentence: パーフェクトですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That sounds perfect.

conversation.ja_sentence: ルールはゲームを始めれば、みんなすぐわかると思いますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I think everyone will understand the rules once we start playing the game.

conversation.ja_sentence: まさか日本の会社でホワイトエレファントが出来るなんて思ってもいなかったです。
conversation.en_sentence: I never thought I could do a white elephant at a Japanese company.

conversation.ja_sentence: とても楽しみになってきました。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm getting excited.

conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は、その日にアグリーセーターも着てきます。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll wear an ugly sweater on that day.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、A株式会社です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is A company.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for calling.

conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなご用件でしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: What can I help you with?

conversation.ja_sentence: Bパズルですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Are you inquiring about the B puzzle?

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありません。
conversation.en_sentence: I apologize for the inconvenience.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらは、メーカー廃盤となっておりまして、残念ながら再入荷の予定がございません。
conversation.en_sentence: The manufacturer no longer produces it so we won't be able to stock up on this item any longer.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですか...。
conversation.en_sentence: Well, about that ...

conversation.ja_sentence: 実はですね、ひとつだけございます。
conversation.en_sentence: We actually still have one available here.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、若干箱が潰れておりまして。
conversation.en_sentence: But the box has been somewhat flattened.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのために在庫から外していました。
conversation.en_sentence: We removed it from our stocks due to this reason.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中の商品には、まったく問題ないのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: There should be no problem with what's inside though.

conversation.ja_sentence: もし、このような状態でも気になさらないようであれば、お売りすることは可能ですが、いかがでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: We can put this back up on sale if you don't have a problem with the condition of the box.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、それはございません。
conversation.en_sentence: That's right.

conversation.ja_sentence: 承知致しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Alright then.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご了承いただき、ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your understanding.

conversation.ja_sentence: では、その分送料はこちら持ちで、送らせていただきますね。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll have it delivered to you with the shipping fee covered.

conversation.ja_sentence: 申し訳ありませんが、お支払いは代引きにしていただいても宜しいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Are you alright with cash on delivery as the method of payment?

conversation.ja_sentence: FAXをお持ちでしたら、金額などを記載してご注文書を送らせていただきますが。
conversation.en_sentence: If you have a fax machine, I can send you the order invoice with the price included.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、すぐ送りますので、どうぞよろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll send the invoice to you as soon as possible.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは失礼致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Sure thing.

conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、私、山本と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, hello, this is Yamamoto.

conversation.ja_sentence: 御社のサイトを見てお電話したのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I decided to call you after seeing your company's website.

conversation.ja_sentence: Bパズルが欲しくて、ネットで販売ページを見たんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm interested in one of your B puzzles that I saw on your online shop.

conversation.ja_sentence: でも、「在庫切れ」と書いてあったので。
conversation.en_sentence: However, it says on the page that it's sold-out.

conversation.ja_sentence: 次の入荷はいつ頃になりますか？
conversation.en_sentence: When will it be available again?

conversation.ja_sentence: 廃盤ですか...。
conversation.en_sentence: Discontinued, huh...

conversation.ja_sentence: 勉強になりそうだから、どうしても孫に買ってやりたいと思っていて。
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to buy it for my grandchild because it seemed like an engaging game.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他のお店もいくつか見たんですが、見つからなくて。
conversation.en_sentence: I've tried other shops but I couldn't find any.

conversation.ja_sentence: そちらのお店なら、もしもお店にあれば、ちょっと遠いけど買いに行けるかな、と思ったんですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm willing to stop by your shop if you have it in stock even if it's a bit far.

conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: パズルには不良はないんですね？

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、それで構いません。
conversation.en_sentence: I don't mind.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうせ、箱は後で捨ててしまいますから。
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to throw the box out anyway.

conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、送っていただけるんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, you'll have it sent to me?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かります！
conversation.en_sentence: That would be a great help!

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、よろしくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll give you my number.

conversation.ja_sentence: 番号は、xxxx-xx-xxxxです。
conversation.en_sentence: My number is xxxx-xx-xxxx.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お待ちしております。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll be waiting for it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、ご出席ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your attendance, everyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今日はセールス拡大のための意見交換をしたいと思います。
conversation.en_sentence: Today I'd like to brainstorm some ideas to increase sales.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご愛用者プログラムを導入するのはどうでしょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: I was thinking of employing a customer loyalty program.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の企業では大成功しているようですし。
conversation.en_sentence: It's been very successful with other companies.

conversation.ja_sentence: おそらくポイント制のシステムになるでしょうね。
conversation.en_sentence: We would probably use a point-based system.

conversation.ja_sentence: お客様にレジで登録していただいて、レジでスキャンできるカードをお渡しするんです。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll have customers sign up at the register, where we'll give them a card that can be scanned at the register.

conversation.ja_sentence: お客様はスムージーを注文する度にポイントがもらえます。
conversation.en_sentence: They'll get points for each smoothie they order.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高い商品を注文すれば、その分もっとポイントがもらえるんです。
conversation.en_sentence: They will also get more points if their order is more expensive.

conversation.ja_sentence: ポイントが十分貯まれば、スムージーを無料で一杯もらえる仕組みです。
conversation.en_sentence: Once they rack up enough points, they can get a free cup of smoothie.

conversation.ja_sentence: 良いアイディアですね！
conversation.en_sentence: That's a great idea!

conversation.ja_sentence: 他にも意見はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Any other ideas?

conversation.ja_sentence: それも良いアイディアですね。
conversation.en_sentence: That also seems like a good idea.

conversation.ja_sentence: どちらのアイディアにも長所短所がありそうです。
conversation.en_sentence: I can see the pros and cons to both.

conversation.ja_sentence: あるいは再利用できるカップをポイントシステムに組み込めるかもしれませんね。
conversation.en_sentence: Perhaps we could integrate the reusable cups into the point system.

conversation.ja_sentence: 店頭でカップも販売するんですが、会員プログラムはやはりカードで行うんです。
conversation.en_sentence: We could sell the cups in the store, but still have the membership program be on the card.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会員ならカップを割引価格で買えたり、特典として無料でもらえたりしても良いですね。
conversation.en_sentence: But if you're a member, maybe you can get a discount on the cup or get it for free as a reward.

conversation.ja_sentence: もう少し検討が必要ですが、アイディアをありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: I'll have to think about it a bit more, but thank you for the ideas.

conversation.ja_sentence: 別所さん、来週のミーティングまでにあなたのチームでカップとカードのデザイン案を幾つか準備してもらえますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Ms. Bessho, can your team prepare a few design ideas for the cup and card by next week's meeting?

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週のミーティングでアイディアをまとめましょう。
conversation.en_sentence: We'll finalize our ideas at next week's meetings.
